The configuration setting that ensures virtual networks on a virtual switch are isolated from each other is:

A. VLAN ID

VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network) ID is a method used to logically divide a physical network into multiple isolated broadcast domains. When applied to virtual switches, assigning different VLAN IDs to different port groups ensures network isolation among the virtual networks. Each VLAN represents a separate broadcast domain, allowing traffic within a VLAN to be kept separate from traffic in other VLANs, thus achieving network isolation for the respective virtual networks connected to the virtual switch.

What is a benefit of VMware vSphere Storage APIs - Data Protection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The benefit of VMware vSphere Storage APIs - Data Protection (VADP) is:

D. It enables centralized, off-host, LAN-free backup of vSphere virtual machines.

VMware vSphere Storage APIs - Data Protection (VADP) is designed to enhance data protection capabilities for vSphere environments. It allows for centralized, off-host backup operations by enabling third-party backup software to interact with vSphere's storage subsystem directly. VADP helps in performing efficient backups of virtual machines without affecting their production performance, utilizing features such as Changed Block Tracking (CBT) to back up only the changed data, thus reducing backup time and improving efficiency. This method can often be performed without impacting the LAN by leveraging direct access to the storage, hence the term "LAN-free backup."

Selected Answer: D
D is correct:

What is VMware vSphere Storage APIs – Data Protection?

VMware vSphere Storage APIs – Data Protection is the next generation of VMware’s data protection framework originally introduced in vSphere 4.0 that enables backup products to do centralized, efficient, off-host LAN free backup of vSphere virtual machines.
